result.execSummary:
The defendant Coleton P. SCHRY was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • PTC Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with all sentences defendant is presently serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay $1,000.00 restitution joint and several with Brett Holtz to Capitol Insurance for the Lewis claim c/o Jane Lambrecht at 1600 Aspen Commons, Middleton, WI 53562-4718.
Pay $663.49 restitution to Brett Holtz (co-defendant Holtz paid all out of pocket expenses to Chris Lewis) at 615 Freemont Street, #8, Kiel, WI 53042.
Court orders the defendant to make restitution payments from any earnings made while in prison and that restitution be paid first to citizen victims, then to co-defendant Brett Holtz and then to Capitol Insurance.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

No contact with Brandon Rabe, Karen Kratz, Brett Holtz, Chris Lewis and his place of business, Stacy Schweitzer and her residence, Kenneth Alfson and his residence, Jay Goldman and John Kunesh.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.
